articles.author: Haaretz
articles.title: 'Blood Moon': Total Lunar Eclipse Was Visible Across Israel, Middle East - Haaretz
articles.description: The 'blood moon,' which reached its peak at 9:12 P.M., was visible across the Middle East, Asia and beyond; the next total lunar eclipse won't occur until 2028
articles.content:
A total lunar eclipse was visible in Israel and much of Asia on Sunday, offering a striking celestial display.
In Israel, the eclipse began at 7:27 P.M., when the Earth's shadow first touched the mo… [+1497 chars]
